intro: Boea brettiana, commonly known as the silver vine, is a climbing plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its trailing stems and small, opposite leaves. The leaves are typically ovate to elliptical in shape, with a silvery-blue underside that gives the plant its common name. It produces small, white flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by red, fleshy berries. This plant is often grown as a decorative vine due to its attractive foliage and ease of care.
